intro: Roupellina boivinii, commonly known as the Boivin's roupellina, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
